title: 108_s348
content: The "Make College Affordable Act of 2003" is introduced, which includes an expansion of the deduction for higher education expenses under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment sets limitations on the amount allowed as a deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses for taxpayers in any taxable year. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is limited based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income. For the taxable year 2003, the deduction is $8,000, and for 2004 and beyond, it is $12,000. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is limited based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, which is calculated as a ratio of the taxpayer's income over a certain threshold. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is limited based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, calculated without certain deductions and after applying specific tax sections. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is limited based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, calculated without certain deductions and after applying specific tax sections. Inflation adjustments are made to dollar amounts in subparagraphs for taxable years after 2003. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is subject to inflation adjustments based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year in which the taxable year begins. Amounts adjusted must be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is subject to inflation adjustments and must be rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. Amendments include defining eligible students and referencing section 25A(b)(3) for the term 'eligible student'. The deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses is made permanent, with amendments to definitions and rules. The term 'eligible student' is now defined as per section 25A(b)(3). These changes apply to payments after December 31, 2002. SEC. 25C. INTEREST ON HIGHER EDUCATION LOANS. This section provides a credit for interest on higher education loans. The tax code allows individuals to claim a credit for interest paid on qualified education loans, with a maximum credit of $1,500. The credit amount is reduced if the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income exceeds $50,000 ($100,000 for joint filers). The tax code allows a credit for interest paid on qualified education loans, with a maximum credit of $1,500. The credit amount is reduced if the taxpayer's income exceeds $50,000 ($100,000 for joint filers), based on modified adjusted gross income. The modified adjusted gross income excludes certain income sections for tax purposes. Amounts for income thresholds are adjusted for inflation annually. Amounts are rounded to the nearest multiple of $50 if not already a multiple. The tax credit for education loans is limited to the first 60 months of interest payments. No credit is allowed if a deduction for the individual is claimed by another taxpayer in the same calendar year. Amounts adjusted for inflation are rounded to the nearest multiple of $50. The tax credit for education loans is limited to the first 60 months of interest payments on qualified education loans. No credit is allowed if a deduction for the individual is claimed by another taxpayer in the same calendar year. Definitions for "qualified education loan" and "dependent" are provided in the section. The tax credit for education loans is subject to special rules, including denial of double benefit, requirement for married couples to file joint returns, and determination of marital status according to specific guidelines. A conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code. The taxpayer and their spouse must file a joint return for the taxable year, with marital status determined according to specific guidelines. A conforming amendment is made to the Internal Revenue Code. The amendments made by this section apply to any qualified education loan incurred before or after the enactment of this Act, with respect to loan interest payments due after December 31, 2002.
